doc.after: The Yuezhi may have been an Europoid people, as indicated by the portraits of their kings on the coins they struck following their exodus to Transoxiana (2ndâ1st century BCE), some old place names in Gansu explainable in Tocharian languages,[25] and especially the coins they struck in India as Kushans (1stâ3rd century CE).[26][27][28][29] Ancient Chinese sources do describe the existence of "white people with long hair" (the Bai people of the Shan Hai Jing) beyond their northwestern border.[citation needed] The Yuezhi (Rouzhi) are associated by some scholars with the Ordos culture of the Ordos Plateau.[30]
